pros: Good people good students pretty campus

pros: Get to know the inner workings of the university’s departments.

pros: Small university, less bureaucratic hurdles for new initiatives and programs, students are great

pros: Good opportunity to get a little extra money through work study, while taking up a minimal amount of time. Relatively easy to make donation goals as a fundraiser.
cons: Obvious downsides of any call-center type jobs - prepare to be rejected a lot! Also, be prepared to follow a pretty strict script/method when calling alumni. Don't expect to earn a lot doing this - like I said, it's more of a side job for students who want to earn a little extra money or have some spare time to kill.

review_title: A lot of potential but ultimately disappointing.
job_title: Event Manager in Brookhaven, DeKalb, GA
pros: The scenery is great. If you're lucky you can peruse the library. There's a really great sense of self-development among a few members of faculty and staff.
cons: The primary challenge of working at Oglethorpe is the unprofessional atmosphere. There is significant difficulty finding professionalism while administrators and staff vie for popularity among undergraduate students, or staff who will not educate themselves about topics and tasks germane to their roles.

review_title: Has the potential to be a great cultural hub in Atlanta, but is hindered by workplace bureaucracies and politics.
pros: Flexible hours, abundant networking opportunities, senior management is very enthusiastic and willing to mentor entry level staff, work environment is small and intimate.
cons: unorganized, poor communication, unprofessional, lots of turnover, unprofessional at times,

pros: The people from the President down were great!  Working in a castle is fun!
cons: Did not reimburse for cell phone, mileage or some expenses.  Lots of turnover.  Lower level management not as good as upper level management!

job_title: Help Desk Technician in Atlanta, GA
pros: The management was very understanding and had a wonderful work environment. Training was very efficient and help was always available.
cons: Pay should increase more per a year or promotion
